page.title: 11Vicar of the Wolfords
page.content: Who is your vicar? Ask this question in our towns and cities and for the most part you will get blank looks or be told the name of the last vicar but two. Ask the question in our villages and most people will know who he is and many will know where he lives, even though that might mean a village three miles away from where he serves three, four or more parishes. The Church is in many ways the village - the source of village identity. There is a strong loyalty to the Church and immense good will towards the clergy. Loyalty is a two way process and the rural clergy find it easy to identify themselves closely with the community in which they serve. In the rural areas the parish priest can still exercise his ancient role of father in God to the people of God.
